Text: One fateful night, when Cid was twelve years old—

Today is the most boring day of my life...
Hm? What's that sound?

(...I take that back. Maybe things're about to get
interesting.)

Baron Kagenou! Forgive me for disturbing you at this
late hour!

A messenger... But what are they doing here so late
at night? And what's the big rush?

As the front door opens the voice's owner hurries
into view, wiping the sweat from his face as he
nears. It's a soldier from the capital.
What on earth brings you here at this ungodly hour?
Sir! I have a message for you from the capital.

Removing a rolled up letter from his breast pocket,
the soldier unfurls it and begins to read its contents
out loud.

We have received complaints that in recent years,
bandits have been rampantly privateering on your
land.
Bandits?! I haven't received any reports of—

(The villages and towns in our territory are run by
their respective leaders and magistrates. Above
them is my father, and above him are ministers
and the King.)

(I get it. Those leaders, magistrates, and townsfolk
are going right over my father's bald head and
straight to the capital to complain.)

(I guess there's a chance my father is smothering
the allegations, but he's not that incompetent... 
He knows how to do his job...I think.)

Please correct this situation at once. Should you
fail, your land will be forfeit and given to another.
Wha—?!
End of message! I bid you farewell!

W-Wait, there's no need to rush... Please, take a
moment to rest and tell me more...

I appreciate the offer, but I must refuse. I must
return and report that you received the message...

Politely refusing the invitation, the soldier about-
faces, mounts his horse, and melts away into the
night.
B-But... Where could bandits like that possibly be...
You don't know, Father?

I haven't received any information of the sort, Cid.
This is a complete surprise!

Something must be done about it at once! This is an
extremely grave situation!
His fingers drum restlessly on the table.

(He's irritated. Or, maybe he's panicking. Or... Is he
thinking about how to deal with the situation?)

First thing tomorrow morning, I'm gathering my
soldiers for a bandit hunt. Start the procedures
for me.
As you say, Sir.

(It seems he decided on the latter— At least he's
thinking of something. Putting together a punitive
force is an adequate response.)

(He is still capable of handling even emergencies.
Some bandits aren't going to be an issue for Baldy...
I hope.)
Father...! I heard—
(Claire...)
The door slams open and Claire bursts into the room.

Any bandits that dare cause a mess on your land are
my enemy as well! Please, take me with yo—
*cough, cough*

Claire... No matter if you're the rising star of
this family, I cannot take you with me in that
condition.

(Lately, my sister has been prone to illness, like an
inbalance between her magic and her body.)

(I'm not one to say much, but her sword skills are
top-notch.)

(The reason why I feel confident in my father is
because my sister's strength is part of that
equation.)

(Basically, since she's in such bad shape,
I'm honestly pretty worried about him.)

(Since I'm just playing the part of a baron's
mediocre son, no one has any deep trust in
my abilites.)
Hmm... Cid is still too young to fight...

Claire, Cid. Leave this to me. I may not be able to
come home for some time, so... Please take care
of your mother.
Ngh... Understood...

(She drags the words out of her throat, squeezing
her fist so tightly that her fingers turn white. She
must be so frustrated.)
Got it. All we gotta do is protect the house, right?

Yes... Anyhow, hurry up and take your bath. It will
help you sleep, and it'll be morning before you
know it.

I can tell he is trying, as the patriarch, to placate
us by the way he's softened his tone.
Alpha, you can come out now.

You heard everything, right? There's something I want
you to do for me.

Gather information regarding the distribution of
bandits within your father's territory, yes?
You got it.
I instantly feel calmer as the stress evaporates.

Slime technology has been pretty much perfected,
but we haven't tested it on any bandits yet.

(Since we've been slacking off on reigning them in,
looks like their numbers have increased.)

(Wait... There's a more important thing at stake here
other than why bandits are everywhere. Our land
might get taken away.)

Understood. Let's wipe out the bandits and protect
your land.

Oh, umm...don't overdo it. Try and keep things as
they are...it's all about balance.
I can tell she's confused.

I'm kind of enjoying my position as the son of some
middle-of-nowhere noble family.

I can't operate in the shadows if the land gets
repossessed. It's important that we don't do
anything to rock the boat.

But on the other hand, if we're too successful and
our land increases that's also a pain. Becoming a
count would make us prime targets.

It's a delicate balance. That's why I'm going to join
you—as Shadow.
But, there is no reason for you to personally—
Alpha.

Forgive me... My mission is reconnaisance.
Understood.

Good. I'm counting on you. If I don't move my body
sometimes, my skills'll get dull.

(This is actually just an excuse to placate Alpha,
but in reality, this will be the first time in a long
time that I taste battle.)

(Since we can't do anything obvious, let's deal with
the bandits from out of sight—)
(As a shadowbroker.)
